definition: A reusable piece of UI that can be composed with other components to form a more complex UI.
A syntax extension for JavaScript that allows you to write HTML-like code in your JavaScript files.
A lightweight representation of the actual DOM that React keeps in memory and uses to calculate the most efficient way to update the actual DOM.
Short for properties, props are a way to pass data from a parent component to a child component.
An object that represents the parts of a component that can change over time.
Special methods that get called at specific points in a component's life, such as when it is first mounted or when it is about to be unmounted.
The process of responding to user actions, such as clicks or key presses, in a web application.
The process of rendering different content based on certain conditions, such as whether a user is logged in or not.
A feature introduced in React 16.8 that allows you to use state and other React features in functional components.
A way to pass data down through a component tree without having to pass props manually at every level.
A way to access the underlying DOM nodes or React components of a rendered component.
A pattern in React where a component takes another component as an argument and returns a new component with additional functionality.
A pattern in React where a component takes a function as a prop and calls that function with some data, allowing the function to render the data in any way it wants.
The process of rendering a React application on the server and sending the resulting HTML to the client, which can improve performance and SEO.
A popular state management library for React applications.
A popular library for handling client-side routing in React applications.
A framework for building native mobile applications using React.
A framework for building server-rendered React applications.
A framework for building static websites using React and GraphQL.
A query language for APIs that allows you to specify exactly what data you need and get it in a single request.
